## Biography

Tim Button’s practice is focused on general corporate counseling including: contract drafting, asset purchases, employment, and non-compete agreements, creditors’ rights, stock acquisitions, commercial financing, commercial and residential real estate, and land use matters, as well as the resolution of commercial disputes.

## Representative Matters

**Real Estate, Land Use & Zoning**

- Represented major hospital corporation before the Metropolitan Development Commission to secure zoning variances and approvals for multiple development projects across multiple hospital campuses.
- Negotiated and reviewed numerous commercial leases in multiple states for a leading provider of cell phone services.

**Business & Corporate Law**

- Counsel to numerous start-up business entities and emerging businesses, including one of the “Inc. 500” _Fastest Growing Private Companies in the United States_.
- Negotiated favorable settlements with client’s former employees who violated their non-compete agreements.

**Bankruptcy & Reorganization**

- Counsel to multi-billion-dollar hedge fund on creditors rights matters including foreclosure proceedings, negotiation of forbearance agreements, and restructuring of debtor obligations.

## Publications & Presentations

###### Presentations

- “The Mini MBA for Attorneys” National Business Institute (June 2018)
- “Helping Your Client Buy or Sell a Small-to-Medium Sized Business,” National Business Institute (December 8, 2014)
- “LLC’s in Indiana,” National Business Institute (June 24, 2013)
- “LLC or Inc.? Entity Selection for a Small to Medium Sized Business,” National Business Institute (June 7, 2012)
